revised_title: Gaseous Oxidation of Aliphatic Alcohols: Isomeric Butyl Alcohols
tldr: The authors studied the gaseous oxidation of isomeric butyl alcohols and found that primary and secondary alcohols are more readily oxidized than tertiary isomers. They discovered that the initial alcohol-oxygen ratio and temperature have little effect on the early stages of reaction, mainly affecting the extent of further oxidation of primary products. The study provides insights into the reaction mechanisms and the role of different products in the oxidation process.
